item.title: Metals Rise After China Hints at Property Sector Support
item.description: Base metals gained on China’s planned new policies to support property developers, but ANZ said investors would require more details before they felt reassured about the economy.

item.title: Dove Maker Unilever Still Raising Prices as Volumes Slip
item.description: The consumer goods giant—which also makes Ben & Jerry’s ice cream—beat second-quarter sales growth expectations.

item.title: Indonesia's Central Bank Stands Pat as Expected
item.description: Bank Indonesia stood pat as expected during its July policy meeting to maintain the stability of the rupiah and ensure that inflation remains under control.

item.title: Oil Pauses Despite China Signaling Property Support
item.description: Oil futures were little changed after China signaled it was considering support for the flagging property sector but stopped short of announcing the broader economic support investors were hoping for.

item.title: Dollar Edges Lower on Tentative Risk Appetite Among Investors
item.description: The dollar edged lower, dented by risk appetite among investors after promises from China’s Politburo of ‘counter-cyclical’ measures, ING said.

item.title: Akzo Nobel Falls Short of Forecasts But Lifts Outlook
item.description: Akzo Nobel posted adjusted earnings of €397 million but raised its full-year guidance despite ongoing economic uncertainties continuing to weigh on its volume growth.

item.title: Political Uncertainty Might Weigh On Spanish Bonds But Economy Helps
item.description: Protracted coalition negotiations and possibly another election in the fourth quarter might still weigh on Spanish government bonds, but economic strength is likely to counter political uncertainty, Citi said.

item.title: Unilever Lifts Guidance as Sales Growth Tops Views
item.description: Unilever posted underlying sales growth of 7.9% for the second quarter, ahead of consensus forecasts, as price increases outweighed a slight decline in volumes, and it raised its full-year sales target.

item.title: Alstom Sales Rise, Maintains Outlook
item.description: Alstom posted a 4.3% rise in first-quarter sales and confirmed its fiscal 2024 outlook and 2026 targets.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 0.1%, Dragged by Tech, Pharma Stocks
item.description: The Nikkei Stock Average ended 0.1% lower at 32682.51 as losses in tech and pharmaceutical stocks offset gains in auto and bank shares.

item.title: Sasol Cautious on Outlook as Sales Fall
item.description: Sasol reported lower chemical sales in 2023 of just under $9 billion and cautioned that it expected continued pricing and demand volatility in fiscal 2024.

item.title: Remy Cointreau Outlook on Track Despite Sales Fall
item.description: Remy Cointreau said sales for the first quarter fell to €258 million, down 35% on an organic basis, due to a continued normalization in U.S. consumption patterns but it remained confident of meeting its outlook for fiscal 2024.

item.title: Dassault Keeps Outlook After Second-Quarter Beat
item.description: Dassault Systemes posted an operating profit of €449 million in the second quarter and an above-forecast margin of 31% and confirmed its guidance for the year.

item.title: Shell to Sell 35% Interest in Indonesia's Masela Block for Up to $650 Million
item.description: Shell is selling its 35% interest in Indonesia’s Masela production sharing contract, which includes the Abadi gas project, to PT Pertamina Hulu Energi and Petronas Masela for up to $650 million in cash.

item.title: Aegon Confident on Bonds as Rate-Hike Cycle Nears End
item.description: Bond investors have good reason for optimism in the coming months as central banks look likely to finish raising interest rates soon, according to Aegon Asset Management.

item.title: The Senate Finance panel is investigating former Apollo CEO Leon Black's tax strategies and dealings with Jeffrey Epstein, pressing the billionaire for information on Epstein's high-price tax advice.
item.description: The Senate Finance panel is investigating former Apollo CEO Leon Black’s tax strategies and dealings with Jeffrey Epstein, pressing the billionaire for information on Epstein’s high-price tax advice.

item.title: Uncertainty over the path of inflation later this summer makes it hard to predict the Fed's next steps following a likely quarter-percentage point increase in interest rates this week.
item.description: Uncertainty over the path of inflation later this summer makes it hard to predict the Fed’s next steps following a likely quarter-percentage point increase in interest rates this week.

item.title: The Dow rose 0.5% for its 11th consecutive day of gains, the average's longest winning streak in six years. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq added 0.4% and 0.2%, respectively.
item.description: The Dow rose 0.5% for its 11th consecutive day of gains, the average’s longest winning streak in six years. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq added 0.4% and 0.2%, respectively.

item.title: The FDIC warned U.S. banks not to take liberties with deposit data after dozens tweaked their numbers to reduce the portions that they said were uninsured in the wake of recent bank failures.
item.description: The FDIC warned U.S. banks not to take liberties with deposit data after dozens tweaked their numbers to reduce the portions that they said were uninsured in the wake of recent bank failures.

item.title: The Justice Department followed through with its threat to sue Texas Gov. Abbott if he didn't remove a floating buoy barrier the state installed on the Rio Grande in a bid to stop migrants from entering the U.S.
item.description: The Justice Department followed through with its threat to sue Texas Gov. Abbott if he didn’t remove a floating buoy barrier the state installed on the Rio Grande in a bid to stop migrants from entering the U.S.
